content: I've got a box shot of Keen 5, i was just wondering if anyone has a boxshot of Keen 4 and 6 (picture from the title screen). I know iD Software has a box shot of Keen 6 in high res, but its the wrong boxshot and i'd like one of the actual title screen (and i know it exists). Im not sure if there is one for Keen 4 though...

title: Re: Keen 6 Box Scan
content:
Indeed! Looks airbrushed actually! And seems like the artist made a slight mistake when masking off the edge of Keen's helmet on the left. There is a teeny strip, about a pixel big, where there is white between the Bloog and the helmet. Also the same mistake is made on the brim of the helmet.

Although I am curious as to what that big white spot is near the bottom of the salt shaker... Looks like its eye but we get the full view of the eye on the front of the Bloog...

Weird.

Conclusion:

Line art: Could use some work.
Coloring: Excellent.
(Why am I critiquing this?)

I wonder who painted the picture. I want to see some of their other works.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://i34.photobucket.com/albums/d134/Galaxieretter/New-blegd-smeeg-banner-60.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Keen 6 Box Scan
content:
I wonder who made the box art as well.
I'm pretty confident in saying that it's the same guy as the GG box art.
I know [url=http://www3.sympatico.ca/kmrieger/]rieger art+design[/url] did the more realistic K6 art, but I doubt that's the same person, although there's a chance it's the same company.
[url=http://www.industrymedia.com/]Industry Media[/url] designed the Keen Chronicles logo, but I don't think they are the artists either.
(Their site seems to be down, suggesting I made a mistake... sure!)

Perhaps the art was simply done in-house; I can't seem to find a signature marking or anything.
Usually box art is done before the actual in-game art, I think.
The neural stunner looks quite different, and does so on the in-game title screen as well.
I suspect the latter were done first, and another (the same?) artist did the box after that.
Only one artist (besides Tom, who drew as well) at id at that time.
We could always ask.
I think we should. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Noticed the white line by the helmet.
I don't see any white spots near the salt shaker.
Are you by any chance referring to the air?
I had to look twice to make out how the Bloog held his arm exactly, at least for the in-game title screen.
It is arched, and you can see the air/background through it.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Re:

title: Re: Full Keen 6 Origional Title Screen Optimization (see pg.
content:
Yeah, those lines were strange.

First off they were hard to 'clean' in/around.

Second, I just now checked the box, and they're not there at all. Example: the purple around the description on the back and on the box edges is quite solid; looking REALLY close with my eyes I can tell it may be dithered, but from most any distance at all it's solid; no indication of striping whatsoever.

Considering it happened to the front AND back, I'm going to assume it's nothing I did and there's nothing much I can do to fix it. The box did seem pretty 'glossy', I wonder if that caused it.

- RG

title: Re: Full Keen 6 Origional Title Screen Optimization (see pg.
content:
@ alex, flaws - Yeah, I knew, I was just commenting on how mine is scratched (poor box =( *sniffle*), and either it, my scanner, or both, are dusty.

The cleaning up I did on my originals was 98% done using Photoshop's healing brush; pretty easy to learn, and extremely effective. I use the eyedropper and go pixel by pixel on the rare stubborn area that the healing brush doesn't want to fix, though.

Did the high res scans though; I honestly haven't scanned much (ever) which is why the thought of dust JUST entered my mind. Bleh. =/

All are TIFFs (uncompressed, unedited), and zipped to preserve the filename.

600dpi (65.35 MB):
[url=http://rapidshare.de/files/21491272/keen6-front-600dpi.zip.html]rapidshare.de/files/21491...i.zip.html[/url]

300dpi (18.94 MB):
[url=http://rapidshare.de/files/21491909/keen6-front-300dpi.zip.html]rapidshare.de/files/21491...i.zip.html[/url]

150dpi (same as the JPEGs from before, just uncompressed this time) (3.85 MB):
[url=http://rapidshare.de/files/21492258/keen6-front-150dpi.zip.html]rapidshare.de/files/21492...i.zip.html[/url]

~All links are Rapidshare; will die after 30 days of no download etc etc...~

~TIFFs can be opened/resized/cropped/converted/etc using [url=http://perso.wanadoo.fr/pierre.g/]XnView[/url]~

Enjoy Galaxieretter, alex87, all!

- RG

title: Re: Full Keen 6 Origional Title Screen Optimization (see pg.
content:
65MB!!!??????[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img]
hmm ill download it but it will take a while [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

by the way did you clean your scanner/box from dust before you scanned it? that might improve the quality a bit.

EDIT: Ok downloaded. I had a look at it, even if i did clean it up, it would look almost the same, because once you scan it too much all you get is the printing dots and so you dont really gain much quality out of it. So yeah. I think my optimized image is big enough though...
